The app is live
Awesome app
love it
Please bring back the old icon, I don't like how this one is essentially just a hollow ring, I can barely see it on most of my wallpapers no matter whether I make it black or white 😕

Most of the texting that I do is group texting with my team, and there are 10 people in the chat. This app seemed to work well with it,  which many others do not. When I got a long string  of different messages from different people,  the name of who sent each was under the text. But then,  after 10 seconds or so, the names disappear, and I can no longer see who sent what. If I wanted to,  I would have to force close the app and then reopen it just to see who sent what for another 10 seconds.

Love the look and feel of the app as well as all the customization. There are a couple bugs though that made me switch back to my default messaging app such as poor integration with lightflow a notification handling app. Also, with Android L, I would get 2 notifications when the screen was on. One for the quick reply and one for the actual notification from the Android OS. Other than that it is a fantastic app going in the right direction. Will be checking on progress as you continue to develop.

Fantastic app that would just need one more change to make it five stars from me. Changes need to be made to the blocked messages section. Firstly the option to password protect this part of the app, furthermore the ability to hide it in the menus but access via holding down the compose button (as with GoSMS and a couple of others).  Other than that, perfect. For the reason above though I would have to stick with GoSMS

I really do want to use this as my primary sms/mms texting app. It's easily the nicest material looking app but it's very unoptimised. I needs to load my conversations every single time I open them and force closes randomly sometimes to the point of restarting the phone.

Installed on Motoro XT1045. Initially I liked the appearance and customization but soon experienced glitches. The most annoying one is that the keyboard keeps disappearing at random times while typing. This makes the app unusable. Second issue was that I was unable to send video MMS. Went back to the stock messaging app, which is not customizable in appearance but at least is reliable and let's me type.

Highly customizable thats what love about this app. But on my Xperia Z Ultra, I cant seem to get rid of the gradient on status bar and navigation bar, if I turn tinting off then both bars will turn black, tried the option in advanced setting, no luck either. Also, going into sms threads lag unpleasantly

I love thw app so far haha. I switched over from Textra. It felt less stable. And less fast. I do however miss being able to the message text from the reply window, changing the notification icon color for different people and a few other things like setting timed messages. Overall great app tho!

That is the app i was looking for and finally i have it. But when i get notification on lock screen and i unlock the phone it enables data connection and some times cast screen.. Some times i open msg notification from status bar it doesn't show mag until i close and open again Pleaaaase fix these bugs .. I will give 6 stars.. I don't wanna delete tht ap..

Great app idea but two major issues.  First being that the delay sending of messages did not work for me. Also,  within a few minutes of using it became quite laggy and almost unusable.  Had to uninstall for those reasons but will keep an eye out to see if issues are corrected.

I love it although i cant see it completely. I have a meizu mx4 and i really like the app but the app doesnt mix well with my screen ratio. Hope devs can attend to my problem cause the app is good and simple then after i will rate this with 5 stars. Thank you.

I really appreciate the good work but it would have been real convenient if you guys give lockscreen notification options when the sensitive option is active in the privacy settings on lollipop (like hangouts give the lock screen notifications, its like 2 new messages from two conversations.) Plus i dont get my screen turned on upon receiving the text on my nexus 5. Furthermore please give the whole conversation on pop up. I would really appreciate if you grant me with a few updates satisfying me. :)

The UI and the app itself is execellent but could use some changes. For example the add buttin in a conversation should be on the left side and adding a voice recorder would benefit alot of people. Also the focus too much on the UI cause a little lag on the app. Making the response performance better would be greatly appreciated. This app is all around the biggest competitior of textra but, it'sHard to decide but for now i will use qksms and see what they improve on it and such.

I would love to use this as my default sms app, but it's been constantly keeping my phone awake when the screen is off, draining 10-20% overnight. I even reinstalled it and tried it again and the same thing happened. Please come up with a fix

As of now, its in good shape, i would request to improve the spam filter to add support for all numbers not in contacts and folders which can filter some messages based on set criteria, and label them. For such amazing sms app, these would really add value, appreciate the efforts

I participated in the app beta and brought up the matter then, but I see that QKSMS has been released and it's still not done. The problem: When I compose an SMS, this app still doesn't display a character counter. How am I supposed to know if I'm getting close to the character limit? I'm not interested in having the app break up long messages into multiple SMS. I just need to know how much space I have left so I can make the most of one SMS.

Good app. Few suggestions if I may: Add multi-select for deleting messages in a thread / Bigger pop-up / Pop-up options to be visible & configurable, not in a drop down menu / When sending a new message, a drop down list with the latest called contacts would be nice.

Omg I downloaded this app and LOVED the material UI. That's where my love stopped. The m and n keys stopped working on my keyboard and I kept getting a persistent message that said "message not found or expired". Thought that was the worst of it until my brother called me and cursed me out because my phone was sending him and his gf the same message over 125 times. Wish I was making this story up.

This app looks sleek and nice and is easy to read. The settings menu is difficult to navigate and could definitely be cleaned up, though. Along with that there are some big drawbacks to using this app. The inability to clear multiple conversations, MMS not working at all, and not being able to copy text from messages really make me want to switch back to the basic messaging app. I'm going to stick it out a little in hopes that it changes, but it sucks losing out on functionality.

I really like the direction this app is headed. It's a nice mix of the things I like from both textra and google messenger. But there are still many bugs. Especially with group messaging, I couldn't figure out who was saying what in my group message. If the bugs get fixed in future updates this could end up being my favorite SMS app.

I love this app. It's pretty, customizable enough, and I haven't had any bugs like in textra (and the no ads are a plus). The only thing that I don't like is there isn't a way to send video, and there isn't a way to choose emoji style. I would definitely upgrade to plus version if these features were added.

I really love this one mainly because it is open source and has awesome features plus look. The only thing currently keeping me away is that it should also have dual sim support. I hope dual sim feature will be added someday. Thanks

When making changes to customize your app, like the font, the changes don't take effect unless you scroll up or down and then back. If it had more customization options like ChompSMS, it would be better and I would definitely pay.

Was a great app until I suddenly ceased receiving audible notifications. My husband thought I was angry with him, but I had to explain that my messenger stopped giving notifications I could hear. I'd have to check periodically. And it stopped blocking the spam texts. And yes, of course I made sure all settings were properly applied. I'm going to reinstall. Because that might help. I shouldn't have to though...

The app has a great look and feel to it but still has some issues to work out. MMS is really poor, with the pop up notification not sending to the whole group on group messages. Also having trouble with it marking messages as read. A few more bugs to knock out and it will be a great app.

A great alternative to Google Messenger. I was looking for an better UI alternative to Textra, and I loved the feel/UI of QK, but it lacked many of the message functionality that I love in Textra (sending scheduled messages, VCards, and GIFs). Overall great app and I'm sure it's only going to get better. Love to support open-source software.

This app is pretty much perfect. The only way to improve it would be to add the option to assign different colors to every contact, sort of like Google messenger does. My main problem that stops me from using it is the fact that the app crashes all the time. I'll reinstall it in a couple of weeks to see if that gets fixed

Nice design and functions well. Proximity sensor to call is a bit broken. When I place my phone on a desk while in a conversation it will start a call.  Fix that and customizable swipe functions like mark as read or delete a conversation and this app would get 5 stars. - Running on OnePlus 3 PureCM Rom

I'd pick someone's name to respond to, and it would send the message to someone else, which makes things confusing. It would claim it sent messages also, but then send them a day or two later. Overall this made for a very confusing time. Not worth it.

Installed to work with should I answer? app but this qk changes settings itself even after I've changed them back. Also, didn't notify with sound of new messages.  Had to constantly check the app to see if I had a message. Settings menu should be less complicated and settings should stick once I set them myself. Overall,  uninstalled after two days of trying multiple things to make it work properly.

I so wanted to love this app, I enjoyed how customisable it is as made my Samsung Galaxy S7 look more my style,  and that it works with the "Should I Answer" app, to block spam messages - however, this app fragments every text I send, even short ones with only a few words - are received in several texts,  often splitting individual words that need piecing together, as are always received out of sync! Each splintered text causes a notification, basically blowing up the recipient's phone, which they find embarrassing!! If I found this out sooner, I wouldn't have used it for the past couple of months! 😰  It's crazy how something so fundamental can ruin an otherwise great app, but this has, this fault has made the app useless!  ☹

Disappointing that there's poor support for group sms otherwise this would be near perfect. All I want is a clean, simple sms app with the ability to quickly text a group of friends regularly. Should be able to create, manage and message a group.  Everything else is well handled.

There's only one reason why I don't use this app (as well as Textra). I do a lot of group messaging, and when you try to add multiple recipients, after you type in a name, the cursor goes straight to the "message section," rather than staying in the "contacts section" so that I can continue to add more recipients. I have to go tap the contacts section again to add more people. Not an issue for many, but an annoyance for me. Otherwise, great app!

Used to be cool. Now I can't send or receive MMS after I upgraded to N7. I Only needed it because my stock msg app was incompatible with my spam blocker. Now I have to switch default msg apps to send/rec a pic. Doesn't seem like the app will ever be updated again.

i like it, it looks really nice and whatnot, but the auto mms settings threw my phone off so bad that i had to factory reset it to get them back. that and every mms i get now shows up as the same one picture. it might be promising in the future but as of right now it just isn't there yet.

!!!Be Warned!!! Great App except it will continually sign you up to Premium SMS and also continually uploads your private data, messages and microphone on demand to a private paid Amazon server service in the background. I presume the App is legit because of the quality so i assume security it just compromised in the app itself or the server to which it communicates. So much for the Open Source appeal!

It took up to 5 seconds just for my texts to pop up in the conversation. Half the time it wouldn't open. I cant customize the light notification to individual contacts in another app like i can with textra. Plus the texts don't show up on my lock screen. I think the colors are amazing but at this point are to many bugs going on at this point i cant use it.

Clean interface and nice to use. Doesn't offer as many features as textra. Ended up changing back as the app would cause a lot of hanging on my phone and after the last few updates crashed on occasion too.

MMS is really buggy and mostly doesn't work. Can't download pictures. Also there is no animation when sending or receiving texts. Was going to switch from Google Messenger but not anymore unless MMS is fixed. Otherwise it's one of the best sms apps on the Play Store. Developer needs to focus on the main problems first instead of adding new features. Will give 5 stars if this problem is fixed.
QKSMS is the messaging app I want to use but the bugs just make it intolerable. Can't handle group messages without crashing.

The pop up quick reply is buggy and the app will make your pop up notifications for Facebook messenger disappear. If the bugs were fixed I would gladly give a 5 star rating and redownload. Everything was great beside that

This app is just awesome and full of features I wanted in a single app. The interface with tabbed conversations, the new button from Lollipop Messenger, the overall animations are nice.  I would rate it 5 stars if it had the option to set custom ringtones for individual contacts.  I also noticed few bugs like there is no delete confirmation dialog box, please add it as its important. Also, the search button works like expected but, clicking on the search result should open that particular message instead of taking to the bottom of that conversation.  Keep up the good work!

Love the look and flow of this app, but my only gripes are: 1) lack of notifications for group mms. When I receive a group text, the only way I can tell that it's been received is by going into the app itself. All the notifications work for single person texts only. 2) frequently the quick text reply defaults to the previous sender, so if I get a text from person B, the quick text reply is for person A.  If these issues were fixed, I'd definitely switch fully to QK!
My saved contacts are not displayed when I receive a message I just see the number instead.. I found no option in settings. Kindly help me out.

I initially downloaded this app 2coincide with "should I answer." At 1st it was ok. Luv the theme changing 4each person. After a while I found several flaws n the app. Which were 1) It doesn't allow all messages 2come thru. I was missing out on quite a few mms messages & some sms. 2) It doesn't keep messages n last n at the top. My most frequent person I would txt, I always had 2scroll down 2find her name 2send another message 2her. 3) The same most frequent person had an exclamation mark next 2her name 4about a month. It was because when I sent a pic message, it never went thru. It was being held as a draft 4some reason. & There's no place 2pull up drafts. 4) Some mms messages were being sent sideways. 5) There's a delay n sending & receiving messages. & I didn't have it set 4a delay. 6) When I'm using another app on my fon & get a message, other apps pause & close out, giving this app priority. I don't always want 2read my messages right away. Especially if I'm already doing something else with my fon. I had 2go back 2my original txtn app. If u can fix these bugs, then I'd rate a 5 & re-download it. Thanks

Just started using this app and I love 99%of it, but it has one issue that keeps me from using it.  On a galaxy S7 edge on T-mobile, I can't send MMS with WiFi on.  Tried changing the settings but nothing worked.  If this gets fixed I'm going back ASAP.

This app has everything I was looking for both function and aesthetically but, with my Nexus 5 running Lollipop, it crashes so often that it's almost impossible to use. It crashes for almost everything, even when I unlock my phone. Please fix and it will be perfect.

Great sms app, but lacks an important feature for me. The ability to attach contact details in a message. Also sometimes contacts appear as numbers and not names. Other than that, still worth using daily!

Almost the best SMS app I've tried: quick to launch, sleek interface and  beautiful police, and most of all open source!  A few downsides though:  -you can't disable that clicking on a contact icon in the app opens the contact page, and not the conversation  -i didn't find if it is possible to send group messages as SMS instead of MMS  -locked screen notifications don't seem to work if I set a password   Overall, I find it very good and use it daily  @Moez Bhatti : Somehow I can't reproduce my bug. I have configured QKSMS so that when I get a message, it is displayed as a popup even if my phone is locked.  A few weeks back I had a password to my lockscreen and I couldn't manage to have this popups displayed, I had to unlock the phone. So I disabled the password and everything worked fine. Today, I tried to reproduce my problem and I couldn't. I don't know if the bug was a side effect of sorts that has been corrected since then, or if I changed something in my phone config, or if the recent update of Android I installed has something to do with it... Anyway, if I can reproduce my problem some day I'll open a bug report on GitHub but for now it's all good.

For those who liked but now doesnt have samsung messaging app this is perfect choice. Would be nice to have scheduled sms option.
